thread.title: Police say 4-year-old shot in New Mexico road-rage incident
thread.title_full: Police say 4-year-old shot in New Mexico road-rage incident - US News

author: USNews
title: Police say 4-year-old shot in New Mexico road-rage incident
text:
Police say 4-year-old shot in New Mexico road rage incident; officers search for suspect Associated Press Oct. 20, 2015 | 6:50 p.m. EDT + More ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) â€” Albuquerque police say a 4-year-old has been shot in a road-rage incident on the city's west side.
Police spokeswoman Celina Espinoza confirmed the child was transported to an area hospital. She says police are searching for a suspect.
The victim's condition was not immediately known.
Officer Simon Drobik says the shooting late Tuesday afternoon prompted authorities to shut down westbound traffic on a section of Interstate 40 as police investigate.
The shooting comes after a road rage shooting last month in which police say a man shot another driver in self-defense. The Sept. 9 shooting that wounded 34-year-old Jacoby Johnson was being reviewed by the District Attorney's Office.
